page.title: 10Homes and Housing
page.content: Housing is mainly concentrated in the villages with some buildings along the roads. Oldest houses are built with Yorkshire stone and some handmade bricks, with roofs of pantiles or stone slabs. New houses are Yorkshire stone with roofs of pantiles, blue slates or concrete tiles. Some stone dwellings have been converted from reduntant farm outbuildings. Many old buildings are historically listed so that features such as catslide roofs and Yorkshire lights will not disappear. Housing is mainly owner-occupied, except for a few council houses and privately owned tenant houses. The County Structure Plan reduces the rate of house building to local needs to protect village character and to preserve farmland. Mandatory grants are available for basic amenities.
